intro: Dendrobium bensoniae var. aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic plant that grows on trees and rocks, often in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom during the dry season. Its pseudobulbs store water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in seasonal droughts. The leaves are typically革质 (leathery) and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem.
